items.title: Kal draws... Poor impulse control
items.description: As president, Donald Trump needs to pause, reflect and resist the urge to attack when communicating. But can he think twice before speaking? Our cartoonist Kal gives his take
items.subtitle: Tuesday, March 21st 2017
items.long_title: Daily Watch this week: Kal draws... Poor impulse control

items.title: Which gender is happier?
items.description: Smiling, enjoyment and laughter are just some of the ways of expressing well being. On International Happiness Day we ask people in New York City if men or women are happier.
items.subtitle: Monday, March 20th 2017
items.long_title: Daily Watch this week: Which gender is happier?

items.title: Ocean
items.description: The Oceans series examines the cutting edge science and radical thinking at work in tackling the crisis facing the world’s seas. This series reflects the passion of those at the frontline of marine biology, and tells the story of the challenge now confronting us as we explore the world’s oceans

items.title: Saving Corals
items.description: With the world's corals threatened with extinction, scientists are using cutting edge technology to help these planetary treasures make a comeback
items.subtitle: Ocean: Episode 1

items.title: Global Compass
items.description: Discover the radical thinking and powerful personalities tackling issues of life and death – and everything in between.  Global Compass searches for the key to solving some of the world’s biggest and most challenging problems – and reveals how one powerful idea can become the dynamo for change across the globe.

items.title: Prison: Breaking the cycle
items.description: No money, no support, no prospects.  After years on the inside, what does freedom look like?  Discover why more former prisoners are reoffending than ever before – and what is being done to break the cycle.
items.subtitle: Global Compass: Episode 1
items.long_title: Global Compass: Prison: Breaking the cycle

items.title: 24 & ready to die
items.description: Emily is 24 years old and physically healthy. But she wants her doctors to end her life.
items.subtitle: Global Compas: Episode 2

items.title: Health without wealth
items.description: Can doctors save lives at the same time as saving money? Pioneering heart surgeon Dr Devi Shetty is one of those on a mission to make world-class treatment available to all.
items.subtitle: Global Compass: Episode 3

items.title: Solar Frontiers
items.description: Meet the men and women bringing solar power to the people – and fighting to transform our global energy supply.
items.subtitle: Global Compass: Episode 4

items.title: Drugs: War or Store?
items.description: From Portuguese heroin addicts to Denver drug stores … this is the endgame in the war on drugs and the story of the breaking of a global policy taboo.
items.subtitle: Global Compass: Episode 5
items.long_title: Global Compass: Drugs: War or Store?

items.title: The Earth Circle
items.description: Making waste a thing of the past, new ideas on the environment are reusing or regenerating raw materials so that they pay dividends for business as well as the planet.
items.subtitle: Global Compass: Episode 6

items.title: The Agenda
items.description: THE AGENDA explores the defining questions of our time and seeks out the stories, solutions and the personalities who might just hold the answers.  Discover the mould-breakers experimenting with new ways to approach some of the modern world’s most fundamental issues; find out what happens when bold ideas and real life collide, and meet the leaders whose thoughts and actions are themselves helping to shape the agenda.   Series One of The Agenda: People Power gets to grips with the rise of populism and what lies behind it

items.title: People Power
items.description: It’s the force that is reshaping our world—from the streets of Turin to Silicon Valley. With frustrations rising and the old order apparently crumbling who really has the answers?
items.subtitle: The Agenda: Episode 1

items.title: Minouche Shafik on education
items.description: Minouche Shafik, deputy governor of the Bank of England and the next director of the London School of Economics, discusses the role of education in a world coloured by populism
items.subtitle: The Agenda: Episode 2
items.long_title: The Agenda: Minouche Shafik on education

items.title: Arianna Huffington on the media
items.description: Arianna Huffington, founder of The Huffington Post, shares her views on the role of journalism in a political world transformed by populism
items.subtitle: The Agenda: Episode 3
items.long_title: The Agenda: Arianna Huffington on the media

items.title: Christine Lagarde on globalisation
items.description: From the elite bubble of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Christine Lagarde, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, shares her views on the future of globalisation
items.subtitle: The Agenda: Episode 4
items.long_title: The Agenda: Christine Lagarde on globalisation

items.title: Winnie Byanyima on inequality
items.description: Winnie Byanyima, the executive director of Oxfam International, discusses the world economy's failure to tackle the extremes of inequality
items.subtitle: The Agenda: Episode 5
items.long_title: The Agenda: Winnie Byanyima on inequality

items.title: Margrethe Vestager on Europe
items.description: Margrethe Vestager, European Commissioner for Competition, shares her views on an isolated Brussels at the centre of a Europe in the midst of upheaval
items.subtitle: The Agenda: Episode 6
items.long_title: The Agenda: Margrethe Vestager on Europe

items.title: The Disrupters
items.description: The digital revolution is driving change on an unprecedented scale.  Confronted by wave after wave of innovation, the pressure to adapt has never been greater.  But where there’s threat there’s also opportunity.  Disrupters takes you behind the scenes of some of the most successful start-ups on the planet – and reveals how their more established rivals are fighting back

items.title: Gear Shift
items.description: Ride-hailing apps such as Uber, Ola and Lyft are not only challenging taxi drivers around the world, they are disrupting the whole car industry as people increasingly ask ‘why drive when I can ride?’
items.subtitle: Disrupters: Episode 1

items.title: The Music Factory
items.description: The music industry has faced decades of upheaval. But one thing has been slow to change - the business model.  Radiohead, Moby and social media star Jacob Whitesides reveal how artists and tech startups are now using the digital revolution to rewrite the rules.musicians to find fans and manage their money—without having to rely on a record deal.
items.subtitle: Disrupters: Episode 2

items.title: The New Power Generation
items.description: In just eight years, the value of the world’s biggest power companies has halved.  Pressure to reduce carbon emissions and the growth of alternative energy methods has left industry giants scrambling to redefine their role in this new high-tech energy world
items.subtitle: Disrupters: Episode 3
items.long_title: The Disrupters: The New Power Generation

items.title: Passport
items.description: A travel series for the intellectually and culturally curious, Passport explores some of the most exciting city destinations in the world.   Follow at the shoulder of three colourful locals as they take you on a unique tour of their city, showing you the hidden spots they think everyone should see – if only you know where to look.

items.title: Miami
items.description: Miami, the city where happy hour is a lifestyle. Passport: Miami shows you a side to the city that only the locals know. Join a Cuban singer, a beach-runner and a drag queen as they open the doors to their shining, fabulous, soulful city.
items.subtitle: Passport: Episode 1

items.title: Colombo
items.description: The capital of Sri Lanka is forging a new identity. Once this island nation was known for its long-running civil war, but now a fashion designer, a celebrity chef and an expat will show you why its capital has become the fastest growing city destination in the world.  See what they love about this remarkable place.
items.subtitle: Passport: Episode 2

items.title: Buenos Aires
items.description: Slabs of beef, glasses of Malbec and polo—welcome to Buenos Aires.  Tour Argentina's capital with a street artist, a dancer and a polo player.  From the world’s biggest street mural to a traditional Argentine street festival, they reveal how this 21st century city is steeped in the history of the country
items.subtitle: Passport: Episode 3

items.title: Osaka
items.description: Japan’s second city has become the country's fastest growing tourist hotspot. Famed for its food, Osaka stands apart from other cities in Japan. A sushi chef, a poet and a tattoo artist show us why their city is the top choice for the culturally curious visitor.
items.subtitle: Passport: Episode 4

items.title: London
items.description: London is the most visited city destination in the world, but that makes discovering its secrets all the more rewarding.  A cabbie, a hipster and the head of one of London’s most exclusive hotels reveal some of the city’s most unique experiences.
items.subtitle: Passport: Episode 5

items.title: Future Works
items.description: From bionic engineers to E-Sports superstars … meet the people doing tomorrow’s jobs today.  As new technology transforms the workplace, FutureWorks looks beyond the gadgets to reveal what its like to work in the emerging industries of the future.

items.title: Drone Rangers
items.description: They're the pilots of tomorrow - and they never leave the ground.  From the African savannah to Californian building sites, meet the men and women pioneering the use of drones in conservation, disaster recovery and construction
items.subtitle: Future Works: Episode 1

items.title: E-Sports Superstars
items.description: Gaming is the new sport and these are its stars - professional computer gamers whose global exploits are tracked by millions of young, connected fans.  Are they the athletes of the future or geeks who got lucky?
items.subtitle: Future Works: Episode 2

items.title: Space Invaders
items.description: There’s a new space race. In the Mojave desert, Space Invaders follows entrepreneurs and young dreamers as they scramble to get out into the cosmos.  They’re reaching for the stars–and they’re barely out of school
items.subtitle: Future Works: Episode 3

items.title: Meat makers
items.description: They think they’ve found a better way to feed the planet.  Meet the front-runners in the race to create man-made meat.  They’re hoping to revolutionise the food chain.  But can they really improve on nature?
items.subtitle: Future Works: Episode 4

items.title: Body Builders
items.description: These bionic engineers may soon have the power to rebuild you.  The Body Builders are helping to develop the groundbreaking technology that is moving bionics from sci-fi fantasy to the commercial market
items.subtitle: Future Works: Episode 5

items.title: Future Works
items.description: From bionic engineers to E-Sports superstars … meet the people doing tomorrow’s jobs today.  As new technology transforms the workplace, FutureWorks looks beyond the gadgets to reveal what its like to work in the emerging industries of the future.

items.title: Passport
items.description: A travel series for the intellectually and culturally curious, Passport explores some of the most exciting city destinations in the world.   Follow at the shoulder of three colourful locals as they take you on a unique tour of their city, showing you the hidden spots they think everyone should see – if only you know where to look.

items.description: The digital revolution is driving change on an unprecedented scale.  Confronted by wave after wave of innovation, the pressure to adapt has never been greater.  But where there’s threat there’s also opportunity.  Disrupters takes you behind the scenes of some of the most successful start-ups on the planet – and reveals how their more established rivals are fighting back

Discover the mould-breakers experimenting with new ways to approach some of the modern world’s most fundamental issues; find out what happens when bold ideas and real life collide, and meet the leaders whose thoughts and actions are themselves helping to shape the agenda.   Series One of The Agenda: People Power gets to grips with the rise of populism and what lies behind it

items.title: Daily Watch this week
items.description:
Daily Watch is a new way to experience The Economist on a daily basis - with an original, topical short film or video released every day of the working week.

Each film forms part of an eclectic line-up of returning  strands and series - expect smart and succinct analysis, rigorous and accessible journalism and a good dose of wit.

items.title: Ocean
items.description: The Oceans series examines the cutting edge science and radical thinking at work in tackling the crisis facing the world’s seas. This series reflects the passion of those at the frontline of marine biology, and tells the story of the challenge now confronting us as we explore the world’s oceans

items.title: Introducing Economist Films
items.description: What do the jobs of tomorrow look like? Can you make meat without animals? Will startups take us to the stars? What’s the best way to regulate drugs? Economist Films makes short, mind-stretching documentaries that examine big global themes. Each one combines analysis, on-the-ground reporting and a dash of humour to capture the essence of The Economist, the leading current-affairs newspaper, in video form.
items.subtitle: Episode 1

items.title: The World In 2017
items.description: What will be the top ten stand out moments of 2017?  Each year we reveal what will hit the global zeitgeist and why; the major changes that are going to bring us together and tear us apart; the stories we’ll be loving, hating or fearing. The World In… brings you tomorrow’s water-cooler moments, today
